#summary OpenPGM 5 : C Reference : Environment : pgm_shutdown()
#labels Phase-Implementation
#sidebar TOC5CReferenceEnvironment
_Function_
=== Declaration ===
<pre>
#include <pgm/pgm.h>

bool *pgm_shutdown* (void);
</pre>

=== Purpose ===
Shutdown OpenPGM internal machinery.

=== Remarks ===
On Microsoft Windows platforms <tt>pgm_shutdown()</tt> will relinquish use of 1ms high resolution timers via the <tt>[http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd757626(v=vs.85).aspx timeEndPeriod()]</tt> function.

=== Return Value ===
On success, returns <tt>true</tt>.  If the library was not initialized with a call to <tt>[OpenPgm5CReferencePgmInit pgm_init()]</tt>, or calls to <tt>pgm_shutdown()</tt> without a matching <tt>pgm_init()</tt> have occurred then the return value will be <tt>false</tt>.
